replies.body:
Not sure how it was 40 (MR, perhaps), but Bilgewater Cutlass deals magic damage with it's active, so it could be from that before she built it into a BoRK.

> UNIQUE: Deals 100 magic damage and slows the target enemy champion by 25% for 2 seconds. (550 range and 90 seconds cooldown)
I think that's probs most likely if she forgot to use it for the rest of the game (that's somethign I'd do :P). She probs just used it once on the tank or something.

Red buff in threes...?
Red buff does true damage...
Fairly sure thunderlords and deathfire would do a bit more than 40 in a whole game.
Cutlass active, presumably on garen since the damage reduction from his w active would get the damage down to 40 with less than 100 mr

yeah i think it can ONLY be a single use of the cutlass active on a high-MR target. not even the garen with that build wouldve reduced it that much, but its highly likely it was used on another tank with garen in their presence for that extra 10-20MR from aegis, while they were stacking MR from the azir and.....i dunno

its weird that cutlass's active turns from magic damage into physical damage. ive noticed ever since the addition/removal of some items and their components theres been a lot more irrelevant item components that then get "upgraded" to do a completely different effect. like jaurims fist into frozen mallet, or serrated dirk, the item effect gets lost on maw, youmuus AND even duskblade. thankfully its not that strong itself, its good for trading i guess, if you can be bothered actively buying it and using it. its weird that the effect doesnt translate into either of the items, and that they even made a new item with that as its component and didnt incorporate it as its new effect
